elementSpec.desc: documents the notation employed to represent a metrical pattern when this is specified as the value of a met, real, or rhyme attribute on any structural element of a metrical text (e.g. lg, l, or seg).

attDef.desc: indicates whether the notation conveys the abstract metrical form, its actual prosodic realization, or the rhyme scheme, or some combination thereof.

valItem.desc: declaration applies to the abstract metrical form recorded on the met attribute
declaration applies to the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure recorded on the real attribute
declaration applies to the rhyme scheme recorded on the rhyme attribute

attDef.desc: specifies a regular expression defining any value that is legal for this notation.
attDef.valDesc: the value must be a valid regular expression per the World Wide Web Consortium's XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition, Appendix F

elementSpec.desc: documents the intended significance of a particular character or character sequence within a metrical notation, either explicitly or in terms of other symbol elements in the same metDecl.

attDef.desc: specifies the character or character sequence being documented.
attDef.valDesc: any available character or character sequence.

attDef.desc: specifies whether the symbol is defined in terms of other symbols (terminal is set to false) or in prose (terminal is set to true).

classSpec.desc: defines a set of attributes which certain elements may use to represent metrical information.

attDef.desc: contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional metrical structure of the element.
attDef.valDesc: May contain either a standard term for the kind of metrical unit (e.g. hexameter) or an encoded representation for the metrical pattern (e.g. +--+-+-+-+-). In either case, the notation used should be documented by a metDecl element within the encodingDesc of the associated header.

attDef.desc: contains a user-specified encoding for the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure applicable to the element.
attDef.valDesc: May contain either a standard term for the kind of metrical unit (e.g. hexameter) or an encoded representation for the metrical pattern (e.g. +--+-+-+-+-). In either case, the notation used should be documented by a metDecl element within the encodingDesc of the associated header.

attDef.desc: specifies the rhyme scheme applicable to a group of verse lines.
attDef.valDesc: By default, the rhyme scheme is expressed as a string of alphabetic characters each corresponding with a rhyming line. Any non-rhyming lines should be represented by a hyphen or an X. Alternative notations may be defined as for met by use of the metDecl element in the TEI header.

classSpec.desc: groups elements bearing the enjamb attribute.

attDef.desc: indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.

valItem.desc: the line in question runs on into the next

elementSpec.desc: marks the point at which a metrical line may be divided.
marks the rhyming part of a metrical line.

attDef.desc: provides a label to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string instantiates.
